content.description: SDS on the arete, move up good holds to a sinker pocket, and then top out.
content.protection: Pad. This has a good landing.

content.description:
Start sitting/crouching with the left hand in a two finger pocket at 3 feet and the right hand in a hidden undercling just above. Head straight up on crimpy cobbles and pockets/dishes. This is somewhat contrived as the holds on '

Coming Up For Air

' (including the big shelf for feet) and '

Every Hole's A Goal

' are avoided.

This is a straightforward test of finger strength and deadpoint accuracy. It is another very good line that is perhaps a bit stiff at the grade.
content.protection: A few pads are useful as this has some dynamic movement relatively high off the ground.
content.location:
This is located in between '

Coming Up For Air

' and '

Every Hole's A Goal

'.

content.description: Start on the big, obvious hole in the middle of the wall, and go up and left.
content.location: This ascends the middle of the south side of the boulder.

content.description:
Do the same start as for "

Every Hole's A Goal

". Start matched in the big, obvious hueco. Instead of climbing straight up for

Every Hole's A Goal

, traverse right into the streak and then up. This has some techy, subtle movements with a few big powerful moves on painful crips.
content.protection: 2 pads is better for this one.... It traverses a bit, but it has a nice, flat landing.

content.description:
Start sitting with a pair of triangular crimps. Make a difficult move to gain a juggy shelf above. Long moves on good holds lead to an easy and somewhat high finish. This has really enjoyable climbing!

Starting standing with both hands matched on the large shelf is V1-ish and a very popular problem in its own right.
content.protection: A few pads are useful especially if this is at your limit.
content.location:
This is the furthest route left on the main face located just to the right of the '

Sunshine Arete

'.

content.description:
Stand start on

Sunshine Arete

, and work left to right, staying low finish on the 4th Dimension.

This is a good warmup to the left of

Sunshine Arete

. Climb up the right side of the face on big holds.

Start standing, and climb the obvious, black streak on cobbles and pockets. This is not the best quality rock and not the most engaging climbing, but it is a good option for newer climbers. Be mindful of loose rock.
content.location: This is the leftmost route on the boulder, on the side closest to the road. It climbs the obvious black streak.
